ygData.subject: Re: What should I do?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Honestly? Wait till you can at least put 5-10 points into smithing. Then just hunker down because it will cost you most of your saved fortune to earn
ygData.messageBody:
Andrew Unangst wrote:
>
> From: "Andrew Unangst" <andrew_u@...>
>
> Ok, I got about 150pp, from being extreamly lucky. I am level 4 paladin. I
> have 0 smithing. I was wondering if this is enough money to get good, I can
> wait four levels and put all into smithing, because I would like to make my
> own plate and chainmail armor. Or should I forget about smithing because I'm
> in Qeynos, and try tailoring or something?


Honestly?

Wait till you can at least put 5-10 points into smithing.

Then just hunker down because it will cost you most of your saved
fortune to
earn enough skill. I do not know if your skill can exceed your level
times 5 + 5
as that restriction is on normal skills (hence my 1h slash maxes at 90
for 17th)

Just make bits upto 20 skill points, and if you have lots by then (like
100 bits)
then do the lantern thing. Other wise try to make bits in 100 amounts
(five full
stacks) and then convert to making those into lanterns.

This will take lots and lots of time. So don't do it on days you
normally adventure
on. And be prepared for your mouse fingers to be really sore
